TopicTitle: [1.0] KerbPaint - Paint layering for parts (March 30th, 2016) Community Update

Articles.Content: Camacha, if you look back at my post in this thread i had a problem with Comodo anti-virus isolate the kerb paint .exe and it wouldnt work for me till i gave it permissons

If I could receive a copy of your output log just to make sure the plugin is being properly initialized, that would help me diagnose the issue.

Is that simply KSP.log in the main folder? Do you need me to do anything specific in the game?

Is that simply KSP.log in the main folder? Do you need me to do anything specific in the game?

Yes, that one, near the top of the file you should see the assembly loader output noting all the mods that are loaded - This will tell me right away if it was properly loaded. Then I can look later down in the file to see both if the module manager overrides are occurring, and then if it is loading the paint masks with parts.

I've seen that bug sometime before in my own game, and I've never used this mod. I think you might be low on memory.

Nope. It's definitely a bug with the mod. My computer and card are both high-end and this is happening to me too.

Thanks to Texel and his awesome support everything is now working as it should. It was no fault of the mod, but my own combined with a mod manager that did not do what it should do.

My computer and card are both high-end and this is happening to me too.

That does not necessarily mean the problem is caused by the mod.

How do you do this?

The shuttle or the coloring? Just tertiary blue on the Fin and primary orange on the Tank Nose Cone.

Nope. It's definitely a bug with the mod. My computer and card are both high-end and this is happening to me too.

Not an matter of memory, it's the shader replacement hitting things it shouldn't be. Again, this is fixable, I'm just holding off until .23 for tweakables.
Any chance of getting to paint structural panels? Haven't tried painting one in game yet, but I build a lot of my rovers with 'em and it'd be kinda nice to give them some personality.
Great idea! But can you make it savegame-based, so other saves wouldn't be affected?

I love this mod so much!

Check out this pimp rocket and nightclub I built:

(the glowy lights are from the stack in-line RGB lights mod by ASET)
Ya Kerbpaint!
I had a dream last night.. I used kerbpaint on a b9 plane, it looked great, then I woke up
All you need is photoshop and a steady hand, and you could be the guy who updates this for b9!
Still works in .23
So is this dead?

No, It's not dead. I'm just behind on my actual work and haven't had a chance to investigate 0.23 - The update process is going to require a fair bit of code to fix the looming thrust-shader replacement issue, then a bit more work with respect to actually making paint masks for the new parts (unless somebody wishes to volunteer paint masks for all the science).

I would be happy to take on some of the load for this. I've already made variants of textures for B9 and Lack Luster to denote TAC resources and RocketParts/Ore/Metal. unfortunately, I deleted the parts by mistake when I got 0.23. I still have the PSD's though, so it wouldn't take much doing to cary those over to this. Interested?

I would be happy to take on some of the load for this. I've already made variants of textures for B9 and Lack Luster to denote TAC resources and RocketParts/Ore/Metal. unfortunately, I deleted the parts by mistake when I got 0.23. I still have the PSD's though, so it wouldn't take much doing to cary those over to this. Interested?

Very much so, if you'd drop me a private message
ITS HAPPENING!!!! Looking forward to it gents, merry festivus!

With regret, I must report a bug with the large SRB (confirmed by process of elimination, copying one mod at a time into a fresh install):

Same here, issue with the Rockomax SRB, fixed when Kerbpaint removed, which is sad .
Planning on some procedural fairing support?

Hello. Can you solve a problem with this part?

and how about flags on parts?

How do i use this?

I hoover mouse over some part, press p, part stats to pulsate in blue color. But nothing else changes. By clicking part i just grab it.

edit: nevermind, it seems that another mod was caucing a trouble

Edited January 3, 2014 by kiwiak
Looks like I'm going to make a proper Delta glider replica!

Also would like to suggest support for the 6S Service Compartment Tubes. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth!

And don't forget Procedural Fairings.

One last thing, is there a tutorial on how to make your own support? EDIT: Found some instruction in the first post.
